arm_group.description: Use of urinary catheterization in Cesarean section
NO urinary catheterization during Cesarean section

brief_summary.textblock: Use versus non use of urinary catheterization during Second Elective caesarean delivery:

clinical_study.brief_title: Catheterization During Second Elective Caesarean Delivery

detailed_description.textblock:
Evaluation OF use versus non use of urinary catheterization during Second Elective caesarean
      delivery:by urine analysis 24 hours postoperative to exclude urinary tract infection.

criteria.textblock:
inclusion criteria

          -  pregnant females who will undergo  second elective caesarean section at full term
             pregnancy (38:41 weeks gestational age).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Women with history of more than one previous caesarean  Section.

          -  Women with history of a tonic postpartum hemorrhage.

          -  Women with Urinary tract infection in present pregnancy.

          -  Women with diabetes mellitus in present pregnancy.

          -  Women with medical disorder in present pregnancy that obligate monitoring of urine
             output during and after caesarean section, such as severe pre-eclampsia or renal
             disease with pregnancy.

          -  Emergency caesarean section

intervention.description: Urinary tract infection inpatient catheterized versus non catheterized

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation OF Use Versus Non Use of Urinary Catheterization During Second Elective Caesarean Delivery

oversight_info.authority: Egypt: Ministry of Health and Population

primary_outcome.measure: Urine analysis to diagnosed urinary tract infection by leucocytes more than 10 per high power field
primary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of urinary tract infection,an expected average 2 days.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
